sway.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: to move slowly from one side to another
sway.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: The trees swayed gently in the breeze.
sway.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: to influence someone so that they change their opinion
sway.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: Don’t allow yourself to be swayed by his promises.
sway.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: power to rule or influence people
sway.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: These old attitudes still hold sway in the church.
She was now completely under his sway.
sway.translation[1].definitions[1].defin: a swinging movement from side to side
